009
010package imagingbook.common.filter.nonlinear;
011
012import java.awt.Color;
013
014import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
015import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
016import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
017import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm.NormType;
018
019/**
020 * Basic vector median filter for color images implemented
021 * by extending the {@link GenericFilterVector} class.
022 * 
023 * @author W. Burger
024 * @version 2020/12/31
025 */
026public class VectorMedianFilter extends GenericFilterVector {
027        
028        public static class Parameters extends ScalarMedianFilter.Parameters {
029                /** Distance norm to use */
030                public NormType distanceNorm = NormType.L1;
031                
032                /** For testing only */
033                public boolean showMask = false;
034                /** For testing only */
035                public boolean markModifiedPixels = false;
036                /** For testing only */
037                public Color modifiedColor = Color.black;
038                
039        }
040        
041        private final Parameters params;
042        private final CircularMask mask;
043        private final int maskCount;
044        final int[][] maskArray;
045        final int xc, yc;
046        private final float[][] supportRegion;          // supportRegion[i][c] with index i, color component c
047        private final VectorNorm vNorm;
048        private final float[] vals = new float[3];      // check, adapt to depth
049        private final float[] modColor;
050        
051        public int modifiedCount = 0; // for debugging only
052        
053        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
054        
055        public VectorMedianFilter() {   
056                this(new Parameters());
057        }
058        
059        public VectorMedianFilter(Parameters params) {
060                this.params = params;
061                this.mask = new CircularMask(params.radius);
062                this.maskCount = mask.getCount();
063                this.maskArray = mask.getMask();
064                this.xc = this.yc = mask.getCenter();
065                this.supportRegion = new float[maskCount][3];
066                this.vNorm = params.distanceNorm.create();
067                
068                this.modColor = params.modifiedColor.getRGBColorComponents(null);
069
070                if (params.showMask) 
071                        mask.show("Mask-" + this.getClass().getSimpleName());
072        }
073        
074        //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
075        
076        @Override
077        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
078                final float[] pCtr = pack.getPix(u, v);
079                getSupportRegion(pack, u, v);
080                double dCtr = aggregateDistance(pCtr); 
081                double dMin = Double.MAX_VALUE;
082                int jMin = -1;
083                for (int j = 0; j < supportRegion.length; j++) {
084                        float[] p = supportRegion[j];
085                        double d = aggregateDistance(p);
086                        if (d < dMin) {
087                                jMin = j;
088                                dMin = d;
089                        }
090                }
091                float[] pmin = supportRegion[jMin];
092                // modify this pixel only if the min aggregate distance of some
093                // other pixel in the filter region is smaller
094                // than the aggregate distance of the original center pixel:
095                final float[] pF = new float[3];        // the returned color tupel
096                if (dMin < dCtr) {      // modify this pixel
097                        if (params.markModifiedPixels) {
098                                copyPixel(modColor, pF);
099                                modifiedCount++;
100                        }
101                        else {
102                                copyPixel(pmin, pF);
103                        }
104                }
105                else {  // keep the original pixel value
106                        copyPixel(pCtr, pF);
107                }
108                return pF;
109        }
110        
111        private void getSupportRegion(PixelPack src, int u, int v) {
112                // fill 'supportRegion' for current mask position
113                int k = 0;
114                for (int i = 0; i < maskArray.length; i++) {
115                        int ui = u + i - xc;
116                        for (int j = 0; j < maskArray[0].length; j++) {
117                                if (maskArray[i][j] > 0) {
118                                        int vj = v + j - yc;
119                                        src.getPix(ui, vj, vals);
120                                        copyPixel(vals, supportRegion[k]);
121                                        k = k + 1;
122                                }
123                        }
124                }
125        }
126        
127        // find the color with the smallest summed distance to all others.
128        // brute force and thus slow
129        private double aggregateDistance(float[] p) {
130                double d = 0;
131                for (int i = 0; i < supportRegion.length; i++) {
132                        d = d + vNorm.distance(p, supportRegion[i]);
133                }
134                return d;
135        }
136}
